desc:
Manchester University NHS Foundation Trust (MFT) is one of the largest acute Trusts in the UK, employing over 20,000 staff.We are responsible for running a family of nine hospitals across six separate sites, providing a wide range of services from comprehensive local general hospital care through to highly specialised regional and national services.We are the main provider of hospital care to approximately 750,000 people in Manchester and Trafford and the single biggest provider of specialised services in the North West of England. We are also the lead provider for a significant number of specialised services including Breast Care, Vascular, Cardiac, Respiratory, Urology Cancer, Paediatrics, Women’s Services, Ophthalmology and Genomic Medicine.Our vision is to improve the health and quality of life of our diverse population by building an organisation that:Cross-Sectional Cardiac Imaging (CMR/CTA) (10 PAs + 2 negotiable) An exciting and unique opportunity has arisen for a highly motivated cross-sectional cardiac Imaging Consultant to join and expand the existing advanced cardiac imaging team at the largest NHS Foundation Trust in the country. Manchester University NHS Foundation Trust (MFT) was launched on 1st October 2017. The new organisation brought together a group of nine hospitals plus community services, providing a once in a lifetime opportunity to deliver even better services for the people of Manchester, Trafford and beyond. Key Figures: The Trust employs over 20000 Staff, has 2500 beds and an annual turnover of almost £1.6 billion. Our staff attend more than 1,725000 outpatients per year, deliver over 13000 babies and carry out in excess of 189000 operations per year and see in excess of 405000 patients in our A&E departments. The Trust is the largest provider for undergraduate training and the R&D department is the largest in the North West. The Alliance-MFT cross-sectional cardiac Imaging unit was established in 2008 and is housed in a purpose built 2 storey unit within the North West Heart Centre on Wythenshawe Campus (previously University Hospital of South Manchester). The unit is one of very few dedicated cross-sectional cardiac Imaging units in the country and houses 2 CMR scanners (1.5T and 3T) and 1 cardiac CT scanner. Additionally, the unit is equipped with a modern RIS/PACS system and reporting facilities including multi-modality post processing and research software packages (7 CVI 42, 3 VES and Q-Mass licences). The unit also benefits from a multimedia conferencing and training room, a small-scale lab and bio-banking facility and a dedicated research database (REDCap run on an in-house server). A BHF-supported dedicated CMR research scanner will be installed in 2019. Cardiac SPECT and cardiac PET/CT services are provided at Oxford Road Campus where there is also access to a cardiac enabled PET/MR scanner facility as well as dedicated (REDCap based) database facilities linked to the in-house network. Applicants should hold (or be within 6-month of) a CCST in Cardiology (or equivalent) and relevant sub-specialisation in the field of cross-sectional imaging should be evident from their training records, higher degree activities, previous employment and CV, including competency certification from the relevant professional bodies. The new appointee will be a member of the Heart & Lung Division and the post is based at the new North West Cardiac Imaging Centre at Wythenshawe Hospital in Manchester yet cross-site working is encouraged and envisaged long-term. General: As a Consultant the appointee will have full responsibilities for cardiology patients under his/her care within the context of a multidisciplinary team structure. As such the appointee will share clinical responsibilities with colleagues in running the clinical work of the department and take part in the joint on call rota of the department (currently 1 in 13). The appointee will effectively share the clinical responsibilities of running the cross sectional imaging unit (i.e. scan vetting, coding, supervision, reporting etc) with the 2 existing Wythenshawe based cross-sectional imaging Consultants Dr Schmitt (CT and Cross Sectional Imaging Lead 9PAs) and Dr Gaetano Nucifora (CMR lead 12 PAs). The unit’s activity is also supported by a Consultant Radiologist (Dr Melanie Greaves), several visiting Consultants (Drs Abidin, Irvine, Freeman) and Academic Staff (Dr Chris Miller), and clinical and research Fellows. Specifics: The post-holder is expected to contribute significantly to the workload of both cross sectional imaging modalities (CMR & CT) and is encouraged to develop a lead position of joint choosing (eg structural heart disease, clinical standards & audit lead etc) commensurate to the units and Trust needs. The expectation is that the future Job-holder is fully committed to support and/or developing a translational research portfolio that complements and enhances the current clinical and academic endeavours. Day to day duties include vetting and coding scan requests, running and supervising scanning sessions, reporting CT/CMR scans and supervising and training Fellows and Junior Doctors, colleagues, technologists and specialist Nursing staff. Furthermore, the Jobholder is expected to participate in the Surgical/cardiology and subspecialty (eg structural HD) MDTs as well as attend and contribute to the departmental 2-weekly discrepancy/2nd opinion meeting. Interviews will be on 4th April 2019.  For further details / informal visits contact:Dr Matthias Schmitt (0161 291 4076) Matthias.schmitt@mft.nhs.uk, CSI lead and/or Sanjay Sastry, Clinical Director (0161 291 2747) Sanjay.sastry@mft.nhs.ukWe may decide to close this vacancy earlier than the published closing date if sufficient applications are received.Trust policy requires that the cost of submitting & processing the successful applicant/s DBS application be recovered via salary deduction in the first 3 months following start in post. The role will include running the strength and balance falls classes. We are looking to recruit Registered Nurses to become an integral member of the ward multidisciplinary team who will be vital in delivery of high quality, safe and effective care. Opal House is a 41 bedded unit set across 2 floors. We are at the Wythenshawe Hospital Complex Health ward which is based across from the main hospital site, set in our own grounds. We work closely with our colleagues in the community as well as patients, relatives and carers to assess, plan and implement safe, effective discharges. You will provide holistic nursing care for those patients requiring non-acute multidisciplinary care, taking part in board rounds, MDT meetings and Best Interest Meetings. The OPAL House team will provide timely and appropriate care for those patients requiring non-acute multi-disciplinary care in a safe environment, after a period of hospital admission which has resulted in increased frailty from deconditioning or consequence of acute illness. This non-acute environment will allow assessment and evaluation of patients care needs, with the aim of allowing them to return to independent living. At Opal House, we promote a daily routine for our patients, starting in the morning with a MDT approach to assist patients to meet their ADL's and getting dressed to enjoy the day. We have a selection of lounge and dining areas including a dementia lounge where patients can spend their day. We offer activities and events throughout the week such as arm chair exercises, crafts, sing-a-longs and film afternoons. We also have on site chefs who prepare and cook all meals. This is an exciting time to be starting working with us at Opal House. As a new management team, we are looking for fresh ideas, new ways of working and want dedicated, compassionate, caring, enthusiastic, driven staff who want to be part of this. If you think this could be the right area for you to develop new skills, or share with us your existing skills, we would love to meet you. Wythenshawe is a major acute teaching Trust recognised as a Centre of clinical excellence and provides a wide range of health services to the areas of South Manchester, South Trafford, North East Cheshire and West Stockport. We recruit staff that are open, honest and focused on striving for excellence, having built an enviable international reputation on five unwavering principles for clinical excellence, research and development, teaching, learning and for treating patients with compassion, respect and dignity. We offer an exceptional preceptorship package, where our nurses are trusted and supported; recognised, respected and rewarded for delivery of the highest standards of care. It’s the way nursing should be. As part of your 4 week induction and preceptorship, full training, support and material will be provided to enable you to achieve Care Certificate Assessor Status and therefore facilitate the completion of the Fundamental Care Certificate by patient facing staff in bands 1-4 within your unit, in line with national mandatory guidance. To be a nurse at Wythenshawe Hospital is about being part of something special, which is why we need amazing people like you – people who stand out from the crowd. We are looking for real professionals who are adaptable to new roles, responsive to change and always looking to improve and develop innovative practice. We can offer training, flexibility, friendliness and a caring environment in which to work and provide a large number of staff benefits, which you will find listed in the additional information link attached to the vacancy. Post-holders will also have access to our Academy and LEAD Training Programmes. Our vision is to improve the health and quality of life of our diverse population by building an organisation that:    Part of MFT is Manchester Royal Infirmary (MRI). Founded in 1752 with just 12 beds; the MRI has grown to become a large teaching hospital for Manchester University’s Medical School and a specialist regional centre for kidney and pancreas transplants, haematology and sickle cell disease. Our Heart Centre is a major provider of cardiac services in the North West. Around 145,000 patients visit our Accident and Emergency Department each year. Our many medical breakthroughs include being first in the UK to carry out urology surgery using a handheld robotic device and fully 3D system. To aid us to provide optimum care for all the patients we treat, we’re excited to be recruiting for a passionate and driven Financial Management Accountant to be part of the team responsible for the efficient and effective financial service delivery for MRI. Setting and agreeing upon realistic and deliverable activity, income and expenditure budgets for MRI in consultation with the Hospital Management, you’ll oversee the production and distribution of timely and accurate weekly ‘key performance indicators’ in order to ensure we’re on target financially. Professionally, you’ll be CCAB or CIMA qualified with a demonstrable post qualification and possess development and achievement of CPD. What’s more, you’ll demonstrate a good understanding of the NHS, its infrastructure and partner organisations and have wide and varied experience working in a multi-disciplinary, complex environment. Naturally, the ability to deduce key points from large/complex volumes of numerical and other data is essential. As for you personally, you’ll be a strong analytical thinker with the ability to consider the wider picture including future scenario planning. Inevitably, you’ll be able to deliver to tight timescales and work at pace with ease. An impressive communicator, you’ll also have the aptitude to establish and maintain effective working relationships, with a confident and convincing style. This is a truly valuable opportunity to take your career to the next level. With the support of a committed team, and the chance to really put your stamp on this role, you’ll witness your vision and efforts having a direct impact on the lives of thousands of people. So, if you have the drive and creativity to find solutions to complex challenges, you’ll have what it takes to take our Finance team forward whilst thriving within our team and organisation. Interview date: week commencing 11 March, 2019. We have opportunities for both highly motivated newly qualified and experienced nurses in the Division of Medicine. We currently have vacancies accross a number of specialities in Adult Integrated Medicine. The Directorate is dynamic and innovative and is looking to source enthusiastic, motivated individuals with a passion to support members of their local community following illness or injury. Our nurses develop skills in Acute Illness Management, Clinical Skills, and a wide variety of other areas depending on the area they choose to work in. We offer rotational programmes accross the specialities to enable you to build an outstanding professional portfolio. The Division of medicine has embraced the MFT’s “What Matters to Me,” campaign and use it to ensure we find out what is most important to our patients, get to know them well and support them to be involved in all decisions about their care. Specialities within the Division of Medicine are; Older People’s Care At MRI Wards 45 & 46 are dedicated to the care of older people both wards have been awarded the prestigious Quality Mark for Elder Friendly Wards and in 2017, Ward 45 was named the Trusts “Most Improved Ward,” and was very proud to achieve Gold in their Accreditation. Many of the patients we care for are living with Dementia and we are passionate about ensuring our ward environments are calm, therapeutic and support the needs of people who are frail or have cognitive impairment. The team are passionate about “Ending PJ Paralysis,” and together with our team of Therapeutic Activity Coordinators we ensure that our patient’s days are filled with meaningful and therapeutic activities such as Music and Film group sessions, Arts and Crafts and Reminiscence Time. We can offer a rotational post accross Care of the Elderly and Rehabillitation/ Stroke and Acute Medicine. Respiratory Medicine Wards AM1 & AM2 predominately care for patients with acute and chronic respiratory problems. Nurses on these wards will routinely care for acutely unwell patients and become proficient in the knowledge and skills they need to ensure these patients have the best possible outcome. Specialist skills utilised in this area include titration of Oxygen based on Capillary Blood Gases, administering and monitoring Non-Invasive Ventilation in patients with Type 2 respiratory failure and patients who are being treated for Pleural Effusions and Pneumothoraces. Nurses in this area will also be trained to manage artificial airways such as Tracheostomies and Laryngectomies. Our Respiratory wards can also offer a rotation between, the Accident and Emergency unit and the Acute Medical Unit for nurses who want to maximise their Acute Illness Management exposure. Stroke Ward 31 specialises in delivering Acute Stroke Care and Stroke Rehabilitation in line with national best practice guidelines for Stroke Care. We are a very friendly team who work closely together as an Multi-disciplinary Team (MDT) to achieve the best outcomes for our patients. The team has a great professional support network which includes regular interaction and team meetings that allows us to grow, learn and develop together. Alongside the standard preceptorship programme nurses working in this area will develop skills in enteral feeding and insertion of Nasogastric Tubes as well as expertise in effective rehabilitation, holistic care and complex discharge planning. Ward 31 is a great learning environment and very popular with student Nurses who relish the opportunity to work with this supportive team and learn about Stroke, neurology and management of cardiovascular risk factors. On Ward 31 you will develop excellent communication skills and have the privilege of supporting your patients to regain their independence. Endocrinology and Acute Medicine. Ward 6 is a 26 bedded general medical ward caring for patients with a wide range of conditions. We also specialise in endocrinology and Metastatic Spinal Cord Compression. Our team are passionate about delivering a high quality standard of care and ensuring that the patients have an excellent experience during their stay in hospital. Rehabilitation. Ward 32 is a general rehabilitation ward that meets the needs of long term patients that require acute inpatient rehabilitation. It has a fully integrated MDT team and is a brilliant area to work for those nurses who enjoy supporting patients with long term conditions. Our Nursing teams works alongside our community and therapy teams to ensure all the appropriate support is provided to our patients on discharge to avoid avoidable harm or readmission to hospital. Our Consultants provide strong clinical leadership and alongside our Advanced Nurse Practitioners and Specialist Nurses they work closely with the national bodies and charitable organisations to ensure we are at the forefront of current research and are continuously developing and improving our service. Many of our patients within the Adult Integrated Medicine Directorate have their care, treatment and discharge planned under the Mental Capacity Act, so our Nurses develop advanced knowledge and expertise in applying the MCA in practice including legal and ethical considerations. jobtitle: Junior/Senior Clinical Fellow in Intensive Care Medicine
desc:
Manchester University NHS Foundation Trust (MFT) is one of the largest acute Trusts in the UK, employing over 20,000 staff.We are responsible for running a family of nine hospitals across six separate sites, providing a wide range of services from comprehensive local general hospital care through to highly specialised regional and national services.We are the main provider of hospital care to approximately 750,000 people in Manchester and Trafford and the single biggest provider of specialised services in the North West of England. We are also the lead provider for a significant number of specialised services including Breast Care, Vascular, Cardiac, Respiratory, Urology Cancer, Paediatrics, Women’s Services, Ophthalmology and Genomic Medicine.Our vision is to improve the health and quality of life of our diverse population by building an organisation that:Junior or Senior Clinical Fellow in Critical Care Medicine Applications are invited for doctors with suitable experience to work as full time Clinical Fellows in Intensive Care Medicine at Manchester Royal Infirmary for a period of 6 months to 2 years. Posts are available on the junior tier of the rota for those with at least two years’ medical experience, and on the senior tier for those with significant experience in acute medicine, critical care or anaesthesia. The appointee will train in Intensive Care Medicine in one of the UK’s busiest and most exciting units with exposure to a wide range of pathology and specialist patient groups. Opportunities exist to gain experience in areas including ultrasound, echocardiography and cardiopulmonary exercise testing. The department has a strong track record in clinical governance, and active participation in audit and research is encouraged. International medical graduates may be able to take advantage of the Medical Training Initiative scheme under the sponsorship of the Royal College of Physicians. Manchester University Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust is one of the UK’s largest employers, with a wide ranging portfolio of specialty work and a strong academic record. In partnership with The University of Manchester and other collaborators we are rapidly making Manchester the centre of cutting-edge research to improve healthcare worldwide. The Trust has Biomedical Research Centre status awarded by the National Institute of Health Research. This post would suit either a UK candidate wishing to gain experience and practical skills prior to applying for a training number in an acute medical specialty, or an international candidate with significant experience of critical care wishing to consolidate their skills in a new environment while developing a rounded CV. The Critical Care Department The Critical Care department has 40 adult critical care beds (20 ICU and 20 HDU) and serves a large University Teaching Hospital with approximately 1000 beds. There are numerous tertiary services on site offering tremendous clinical experience to the successful applicant. These include renal and pancreatic transplantation, vascular surgery, major maxillo-facial surgery, tertiary obstetrics, cardiology, hepatology, nephrology, haematology, upper GI and hepato-pancreato-biliary surgery. The successful candidate will join a consultant-lead medical workforce with 26 Consultants 26 trainees of all grades. The Intensive Care Unit is a brand new state of the art facility, and admits approximately 700 critically ill adult patients yearly. The average APACHE 2 score is high with few elective patients admitted. The vast majority of the patients are ventilated and have at least 2 organ failures. A team of 24 consultants in Critical Care Medicine provides 24-hour cover. The ICU currently has 20 beds open and is nursed on a 1:1 basis. It is supported by a dedicated team of technicians, has its own laboratory, training and teaching unit. There is a follow-up clinic and active research, teaching and audit programs. The High Dependency Unit admits approximately 1200 patients a year. The Unit works as an integrated Critical Care Service with ICU. The patient acuity is high and the case-mix is extremely wide, offering tremendous educational opportunities for the successful applicant. The medical workforce is multi-disciplinary at both trainees and consultant level (Anaesthesia, Acute Medicine, Emergency Medicine, Nephrology and Respiratory Medicine) and is reflective of the specialty-mix of trainees and case-mix of patients Remuneration will be on the StR payscale which currently ranges from £30,605 to £48,123 per annum, and the banding supplement will be 1A reflecting a full shift system (subject to review). Expressions of interest should be directed to Dr Andy Martin or Dr James Hanison (Faculty Tutors & Consultants in Critical Care Medicine) It will be a condition of employment that the applicants from outside the European Economic Area who apply to come under the Medical Training Initiative will either have passed the IELTS exam with a score of at least 7 in all domains, or will do so within 6 months of the date of interview.   For further details / informal visits contact:Dr James Hanison on james.hanison@mft.nhs.ukConsultant in Intensive Care MedicineWe may decide to close this vacancy earlier than the published closing date if sufficient applications are received.Trust policy requires that the cost of submitting & processing the successful applicant/s DBS application be recovered via salary deduction in the first 3 months following start in post. Founded in 1752 with just 12 beds; the MRI has grown to become a large teaching hospital for Manchester University’s Medical School and a specialist regional centre for kidney and pancreas transplants, haematology and sickle cell disease. Our Heart Centre is a major provider of cardiac services in the North West. Around 145,000 patients visit our Accident and Emergency Department each year. Our many medical breakthroughs include being first in the UK to carry out urology surgery using a handheld robotic device and fully 3D system. We’re excited to be recruiting for a passionate and driven Senior Management Accounting Officer to assist the Financial Management Accountant in areas of financial management and advice. Knowledge of NHS finance and accounting is essential. As for you personally, you’ll have impressive interpersonal, communication and influencing skills with the ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships. jobtitle: Senior Pharmacy Technician - Aseptic Services Lead for Clinical Trial
desc:
Manchester University NHS Foundation Trust (MFT) is one of the largest acute Trusts in the UK, employing over 20,000 staff.We are responsible for running a family of nine hospitals across six separate sites, providing a wide range of services from comprehensive local general hospital care through to highly specialised regional and national services.We are the main provider of hospital care to approximately 750,000 people in Manchester and Trafford and the single biggest provider of specialised services in the North West of England. We are also the lead provider for a significant number of specialised services including Breast Care, Vascular, Cardiac, Respiratory, Urology Cancer, Paediatrics, Women’s Services, Ophthalmology and Genomic Medicine.Our vision is to improve the health and quality of life of our diverse population by building an organisation that:Manchester University NHS Foundation Trust (MFT) is the leading Trust for teaching, research and specialist services in the North West of England. The Clinical Trials Pharmacy supports the medicines aspects of clinical trials to a large number of speciality areas as well as dedicated separate adult and paediatric Wellcome Trust Clinical Research Facilities. As a tertiary referral centre we are involved in novel treatments for many rare conditions and have established systems in place to support these.We offer an exciting opportunity for a motivated individual, who is an excellent team player, flexible, self-motivated and able to demonstrate professionalism, excellent organisational and communication skills. You will be involved in a rapidly expanding adult and children’s pharmacy clinical trials service. We have good working relationships with the various Clinical Trials research teams throughout the Hospital including on-site adult and paediatric specialist research facilities. This is a rare opportunity to gain a job that will enable you to specialise and gain experience in the pharmacy aspects of clinical trials and gain further aseptic experience in one of the largest NHS Trusts in the UK. Based at the Oxford Road Site the Pharmacy Department currently has a number of teams, working innovatively to provide services to the patients. You will be working in an Aseptic Services Unit with 11 clean rooms including a Gene Therapy Suite, which provides Neonatal, Paediatric & Adult PN, Adult & Paediatric Chemotherapy, CIVAS as well as Clinical Trials. You must have excellent attention to detail and be able to follow procedures closely in this tightly regulated environment. Good written and oral communication skills are needed together with a willingness to work in a team environment.You must be able to work accurately, quickly and under pressure, have a good eye for detail, be able to prioritise your workload to meet deadlines and be committed to deliver a high standard patient focused service. Our department has a genuine good balance of professionalism, friendliness and a healthy attitude to "getting the job done". You will work closely with Aseptic Services Senior Technicians as well as Clinical Trials Senior Technicians and you will help lead a team of technical staff and coordinate the preparation and supply of aseptically prepared products. You will contribute to our ethos of providing a positive, forward thinking and professional working environment in which staff work with each other and for each other. As a valued member of the team you will be supported to develop your knowledge of aseptic services, clinical trials and managerial skills to progress in your career. You must be registered with the General Pharmaceutical Council and have a post qualification experience in Aseptic Services. The ideal candidate will have the BTEC Accuracy checking qualification and have some hospital and/or management of clinical trials experience. In return we will provide a comprehensive induction programme and you will be appraised on a yearly basis with a view to developing knowledge and skills where appropriate. Consideration will be given to part-time or job-share candidates. Candidates who do not have the required qualifications or experience may be considered but will be paid as detailed in Annex 21 of Agenda for change until they have the required qualifications and experience. This role is Full time (37.5 hours per week) , to include a 1 in 5 Saturday working, Bank Holiday and on call working as part of a rota. There will be a requirement to participate in extended hours working including late nights, weekend and bank holidays on a rotational basis. You will be joining our friendly and dynamic team with excellent standards and great work ethic. You will be supported to develop into the band 5 role through preceptor-ship, peer support and an exciting range of educational opportunities.Wilson Ward is no ordinary chest ward as we have regional and national specialist respiratory services, giving you the opportunity to learn about nursing patients with a whole range of conditions. Our Trust brings together the expertise of 12,000 staff spread across seven hospitals and community. Our Research and Innovation Division is dedicated to driving continuous improvement in the care our patients receive through clinical research. We support some 300 principal investigators, who undertake research across a diverse range of clinical areas, spread across seven hospitals and community services, to deliver improved diagnostics, treatments and devices for patients in Manchester and beyond. MFT has a large research portfolio, with excellent facilities and internationally renowned researchers; we have a global reputation for conducting and delivering pioneering research. What we’re looking forThis post will be based at MFT in the cardiovascular research team which has an expanding study portfolio and is supported by a very active and dynamic group of PI`s , Research Nurses, and Clinical Trials Coordinator We are looking for a highly motivated and enthusiastic individual who is capable of contributing to the continuing development of research within cardiovascular trials with the additional managerially responsibility for the clinical research team within this speciality. You will take a proactive approach in managing clinical research studies including developing study procedures and practice, gaining consent and approvals and recruiting participants, alongside clinical duties including providing the highest quality patient care and collecting and processing samples. You will be instrumental in implementing study objectives and will provide dedicated support to ensure that studies are delivered to time and target. You will be the main point of contact for study principal investigators, sponsors and patients and so effective communication and team working skills are essential. You will be involved in ensuring that research undertaken at MFT safeguards the well-being of patients and is undertaken within ICH Good Clinical Practice Guidelines. You will also have opportunities to showcase your work and will at all times be an ambassador of research at MFT, at internal and external events. You will be educated to degree level; you must have First Level registration RN Adult and possess current skills, expertise and knowledge of Research Nursing. The successful candidate will join a team that performs a high volume of TAVI procedures via transfemoral, trans-subclavian, trans-carotid / brachiocephalic, transaortic and transapical routes. As such, MFT is one of the highest volume centres for alternative / non-transfemoral access in the UK, benefitting from a fully integrated interventional cardiology and cardiac surgery support service. As a referral hospital from a large number of DGHs, MFT is also one of the highest volume centres for balloon aortic valvuloplasty and PPCI. MFT is also one of only 3 designated TAVI CT training centres in Europe and the only UK centre, running up to 10 courses per year supported by Edwards and Medtronic. The team comprises interventional cardiologists, cardiac surgeons, TAVI nurses and full imaging, interventional radiology and vascular surgical support. There are 2 dedicated TAVI / structural clinics per week, one dedicated TAVI MDT per week, one mitral MDT on alternate weeks, and 1.5 days of lab time weekly, benefitting from the use of a dedicated fully equipped hybrid lab. The post will primarily involve working at Manchester Royal Infirmary, however will involve the possibility of cross-site working with Wythenshawe site in their structural program. In addition, the post will involve 1 or more sessions per week of complex PCI as well as participation on the registrar on call rota including full involvement in the primary PCI rota. The post will involve participation in ongoing structural interventional research and attendance at national and international interventional / structural meetings. The post is ideally suited to an experienced interventional trainee who has already performed a high volume of percutaneous coronary interventions, for whom significant first operator structural interventional experience can be expected as part of this post. The successful candidate will be trained in the use of Medtronic Evolut, Edwards Sapien 3 and Ultra valves, Edwards Centera as well as other technologies. Our specialist hospitals are home to hundreds of world class clinicians and academic staff committed to finding our patients the best care and treatments. Set in a hugely diverse population, our team has many opportunities for the development of new and innovative ways of providing care for the community's spiritual and religious needs. We work as a Multi Faith Team, supporting one another in caring for patients, staff and visitors from a vast range of ethnic, religious and cultural backgrounds. We are involved in training staff in their understanding of spiritual care, end-of-life issues, listening skills and assessment of patient needs. We support the Trust Equality and Diversity agenda and the Trust's commitment to the value statements: Everyone Matters    Our department is involved in all aspects of the life of the Trust, and is well respected across every tier of management and the organisation. We offer opportunities to develop professionally, pursue research projects and work in a wide variety of different contexts within the Trust. This role will provide an opportunity to work alongside the Chaplaincy, in a team of ten, in a busy and culturally diverse organisation. You will be working across the Trust in a service that requires tact, patience and understanding. Part of your role will be providing administrative support to the Chaplaincy Team and to signpost our service to those patients, relatives or staff members of any belief or faith group when requested. You will be a key member in supporting the team as it provides religious and spiritual care to patients, families, carers and staff according to the new 2015 Guidance for NHS Chaplaincy developed under the auspices of NHS England. You will take full responsibility for your role through excellent telephone communications; prompt passing on of information and messages, administration of the teams printed material, purchasing appropriate stationery and consumables, keeping the Centre and Prayer Rooms tidy and well stocked, being a point of contact with visitors, staff patients and their families and creating excellent access to the Chaplaincy Team. You will be offered the level of training and support needed for the role, and encouraged to seek support when appropriate. You will be encouraged to seek further training and do further study in the fields of administration, IT and other appropriate courses. We’re driven by the aim of improving the health of local people in Manchester by working across organisational boundaries. The first health and social care staff have been deployed to us from April 2018 and are now starting to work in new ways across the city. Our teams work as one in the neighbourhoods they serve – delivering and designing services in partnership with local people. We also provide key services that work across wider localities and city-wide. We believe that our pioneering approach will make a massive difference to the health of people in our city and we are looking for you to join our team and help us do this. ......................................................................................................... An exciting opportunity has arisen for B3 Support workers / therapy assistants to join our new integrated Community Crisis Response Team in south Manchester We have 2 full time / 37.5 hour posts available The suitable candidate will demonstrate enthusiasm and be highly motivated. You should be qualified with a relevant NVQ level 3 with excellent communication skills to join our friendly and dynamic Manchester Community Response Service ( of which Crisis Response is one of the teams) to provide high quality and personalised nursing & therapy care to patients in their own homes.Special emphasis is placed on the provision of interventions to prevent hospital admissions with referrals coming from community colleagues, Hospital A&E departments and the North West Ambulance Service (NWAS) The service by nature is busy, diverse in an ever changing environment of health and social integration. You will become a valued member of the team and work closely with the CT Radiographers, Registrars and Consultants but also with the wider multidisciplinary team. The hours for this post are 37.5 hours over 3 days Monday- Sunday. The rota pattern takes the form of 3 x 12 hour days (34.5 hours total) and to make the hours up to 37.5 you will be expected to work 1 accrued hours day per month. We will give you at least 6 weeks notice of the accrued hours day and is generally done in discussion with the CT Lead Radiographer or the Deputy CT Lead Radiographer. After training and successful assessment of competencies you will be uplifted to Band 3. The Manchester Royal Infirmary is a regional referral centres for many specialties and the range and complexities of the examinations carried out reflect this. You will prepare the patients for their examination and ensure the rooms are ready prior to and post procedure along with other departmental duties to support the service. desc:
Manchester University NHS Foundation Trust (MFT) is one of the largest acute Trusts in the UK, employing over 20,000 staff.We are responsible for running a family of nine hospitals across six separate sites, providing a wide range of services from comprehensive local general hospital care through to highly specialised regional and national services.We are the main provider of hospital care to approximately 750,000 people in Manchester and Trafford and the single biggest provider of specialised services in the North West of England. We are also the lead provider for a significant number of specialised services including Breast Care, Vascular, Cardiac, Respiratory, Urology Cancer, Paediatrics, Women’s Services, Ophthalmology and Genomic Medicine.Our vision is to improve the health and quality of life of our diverse population by building an organisation that:Director of HR & OD Salary: Competitive Location: Wythenshawe Hospital  (Incorporating Trafford, Altrincham & Withington Hospitals) This is such an exciting time to come to work in Manchester at the largest NHS Trust in England and the third largest provider of specialist services. Manchester University NHS Foundation Trust (MFT) was formed on the 1st October 2017 as an NHS Group of Acute and Specialist Hospitals and is on an exciting mission to provide world-class healthcare to the people of Manchester, Trafford, and the surrounding areas, and for some of our services, nationally. Benefitting from the support of a progressive academic science centre which is leading health innovation within the UK, our teams are dedicated to working collectively to provide a seamless Single Hospital Service, ultimately improving health outcomes for our local communities. The resulting environment is one of optimistic expectation and it is this varied and dynamic challenge that you will be nurturing as Director of HR&OD in our largest hospital. As a newly formed Group, we are seeking a talented senior HR/OD professional to join the Hospital Leadership Team and to be part of a network of Hospital based Directors working across the Groups’ six hospitals. Our current search for talent is focussed at one of our six sites, Wythenshawe, the largest of our hospitals with a turnover of circa £470m and 5449 staff. With these kind of numbers, we are inevitably keen to attract an inspirational Human Resources Director with previous experience as a Director in either a smaller Hospital or a non-healthcare organisation employing a large number of professionals or significant experience as a Deputy in a large Acute hospital within a similarly complex environment. Reporting to the Chief Executive, the Hospital Director of HR and OD will work as an integral member of the Hospital Leadership supporting the Hospital Chief Executive in developing a compelling vision and narrative. You’ll develop a vibrant staff engagement strategy to ensure our people understand the hospital’s vision and have the ambition to personally contribute to ensuring the hospital consistently delivers its strategic goal of delivering consistently high-quality, safe patient care. Implementing a forward-thinking workforce strategy and supporting organisational development (OD), you will work to guide all HR matters that impact on hospital delivery and performance, ensuring our staff has the necessary skills, knowledge and support to deliver their best performance. Extending from talent development to performance management, your expertise will impact on everything from succession planning to recruitment and retention, building workforce capacity and nurturing talent you will be able to smooth out any issues that might otherwise detract from the exceptional capabilities of these highly skilled professionals. Enjoying the supportive network that has come with our merger, you will have the backing of the other HRDs in the Group. Also benefiting from Group structure, you’ll have more time to do the job you love, without being distracted by the necessary governance commitments which will be undertaken at a board level. This highly desirable role is perfectly suited to a dynamic self-starter with a wealth of OD and HR expertise gained in a senior role within a complex organisation. Membership of the Chartered Institute of Personnel and Development is desirable but not essential, but the ability to quickly build relationships with a whole range of stakeholders at all levels is key and having the drive to influence outcomes is critical coupled with your exceptional leadership skills. We believe in providing a vibrant and engaging working atmosphere for our staff, with good career progression and the scope to make the most of their skills.
